summary: This is an email chain from February 2020 between attorneys at Panish Shea & Boyle LLP and federal prosecutors (likely from the SDNY) regarding the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein. The emails discuss scheduling interviews with a victim/witness (referred to as 'her'), issuing subpoenas for her school records, and coordinating on a related civil lawsuit that had been filed. The tone is cooperative, with the prosecutors keeping the victim's attorneys informed of investigative steps.

persons.name: Kevin Boyle
persons.role: Attorney at Panish Shea & Boyle LLP
persons.context: Attorney providing legal advice regarding subpoena procedures and 'Notice to Consumer' requirements in response to a request from Robert Glassman.

persons.name: Robert Glassman
persons.role: Attorney at Panish Shea & Boyle LLP
persons.context: Primary attorney corresponding with federal prosecutors, coordinating interview schedules for his client (a victim/witness), and discussing the filing of a civil lawsuit related to the Epstein case.

persons.name: Nathan Werksman
persons.role: Attorney at Panish Shea & Boyle LLP
persons.context: Attorney copied on the email chain, part of the legal team representing the victim/witness.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the subject of the SDNY investigation and the civil lawsuit; his conduct is a topic the prosecutors intend to discuss with the victim.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned alongside Epstein as someone whose specific conduct the prosecutors intend to discuss with the victim.

persons.name: John Koeltl
persons.context: Identified as the judge assigned to the civil lawsuit filed by the victim.

persons.name: Barbara Moses
persons.context: Identified as the magistrate judge assigned to the civil lawsuit filed by the victim.

persons.name: Moskowitz
persons.context: Mentioned as having already reached out to the victim's legal team, likely in connection with the civil lawsuit.

connections.description: Attorneys at the same law firm (Panish Shea & Boyle LLP), collaborating on representing a client in the Epstein investigation.
Attorneys at the same law firm, both copied on correspondence regarding their client's case.
Glassman represents a victim who is accusing Epstein of misconduct, as discussed in the context of a civil lawsuit and criminal investigation.
Glassman's client is also making allegations against Maxwell, as prosecutors plan to discuss Maxwell's conduct.
Mentioned together in the context of their alleged conduct towards the victim.

events.title: Civil Lawsuit Filed
events.description: Robert Glassman files a civil lawsuit on behalf of his client against Jeffrey Epstein. The filing is noted in media reports.

events.title: Scheduled Interview with Victim
events.description: Prosecutors from the SDNY and attorneys from Panish Shea & Boyle schedule an in-person interview with the victim/witness for 11:00 a.m.

events.title: Subpoenas for School Records
events.description: SDNY prosecutors inform victim's attorneys they are issuing subpoenas to schools the victim attended to corroborate her timeline, noting they may need to notify her.

events.title: Previous Meeting with Victim
events.description: A prior meeting took place between the SDNY prosecutors, Robert Glassman, and the victim, referenced in the email chain.

keyFacts: The SDNY investigation into Jeffrey Epstein was active and conducting witness interviews as of February 2020.
A victim, represented by Panish Shea & Boyle LLP, had filed a civil lawsuit against Epstein by January 17, 2020, which received media coverage.
Prosecutors were taking steps to corroborate the victim's account, including subpoenaing her school records and planning to interview her family members.

The correspondence shows a cooperative relationship between the victim's civil attorneys and the federal criminal prosecutors, with the prosecutors keeping the attorneys informed of investigative steps that might affect their client.
The victim's allegations involved both Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, and the prosecutors intended to discuss the specific conduct of both individuals.
